data.title: A world class warm welcome. Five stars. Do not stay ANYWHERE else!
data.text: We stayed here for just one night but we can honestly say this was hands down the best place we stayed during our 2 weeks in the States. Jim is a lovely man - so warm and welcoming. He came bounding out of the house to meet us when we arrived, gave us some great recommendations for places to eat and left us cookies for the journey onwards the morning after. The room was cosy, homely and very clean. We had a delicious breakfast at his kitchen table in the morning - he joined us too and told us where the best place was to watch the election when we reached our final destination of Atlanta. A service above and beyond anything we've experienced anywhere in the world. Five stars. A credit to you Jim.

owner_response.author: LatticeInnkeeper, Owner at The Lattice Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Amy and Steve -  I'm humbled by your assessment of the time that we were privileged to have hosted your visit to Montgomery.  Thank you!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: A gem of a place
data.text:
We stayed here for a couple of nights in August as part of a road trip through the South. Right from the start Jim made us feel so welcome, with sweet personal touches in our room. The house itself is utterly charming and the breakfasts were delicious too! We very much recommend this place. Thanks for a lovely stay Jim.

Laura and James

data.title: A wonderful place to relax
data.text:
We stayed three nights at the Lattice Inn, form the start Jim made us feel welcome. The room was amazing and we slept well in the very comfortable bed. The breakfasts were wonderful and the pumpkin cake delicious. 

The room is ideally situated for exploring Downtown, we chose to drive and park by the Capitol, the tourist office gives out visitor's passes valid for one day.

data.title: Great host and wonderful room.
data.text: Jim was a great host and the property was first class.  I would highly recommend this B&B for any visit to Montgomery.  Enjoyed the cookies each night. Also,enjoyed the conversation with Jim and the fellow guest during the delicious breakfast.  Stayed in the Magnolia room with a great bed,fireplace and free bottled water and soft drinks. .

data.title: One night stay
data.text:
Spent one night here en route back to Atlanta at the end of our Southern States road trip.
Jim is a gracious host and looked after us very well. His house is like a TARDIS, small on the outside but so spacious inside.
We stayed in the Sandpiper suite which was large, comfy & tasteful.
Breakfast was good as were the cookies.
Pool was not available to use while we were there as it needed a bit of a clean & I didn't see the hot tub.
We did walk into town via Hull Street & then Perry but it is a fair walk in the heat & some areas on the way are not very salubrious. In fact when we asked a police officer the best route to walk back he actually gave us a lift in his patrol car! Only time I have ever been in one, it made a good photo opportunity.
I would advise driving downtown as there is free tourist parking behind the excellent visitor centre. You can also pick up a free parking permit for the Capital area. There are a number of buildings you can visit for free - the Alabama Archive has a particularly interesting museum.
If you are interested in visiting the grave of Hank Williams head out on Watumpka road past the main entrance until you see a sign pointing left where you can drive right up to the graveside.
Overall we had a great, short stay in Montgomery.

owner_response.author: LatticeInnkeeper, Owner at The Lattice Inn, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Angela and Vaughan -  It was a delight to have had you with us and I appreciate the feedback about your stay with us and your time in Montgomery.  I'm sorry you were unable to enjoy our pool, as recent storms and the fact that it sits under a massive Oak tree sometimes makes it less inviting than it otherwise is.  Please come back again soon!
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Comfort of Home
data.text: Thank you, Jim, for your hospitality from running our keys out to us as we sped away to the Auburn game, making us a yummy breakfast and spending the time to chat with us during breakfast. Wish we could have stayed longer!

data.title: Quiet Stay
data.text: Loved the room, the breakfast, the owner, and his cats. We stayed in the Magnolia Room and loved the spacious bed, fireplace and furniture. The suite's bathroom has plenty of room and a great shower. Breakfast was AMAZING and we felt right at home with cats under our feet at the table. We also enjoyed how conveniently located it was.

data.title: Montgomey Jewel!
data.text: Quaint, comfortable, peaceful and convenient. The Innkeeper, Jim was super friendly and was quick to tend to every need, usually before you could ask. Jim met you at curb upon arrival and took care of everything from there. Lot's of little things that made you feel welcome and your stay enjoyable including a fantastic breakfast!

data.title: Absolutely fantastic. Deserves a higher rating all of its own
data.text:
I stayed here for two nights while travelling on my own. I was impressed from the moment I arrived as I was immediately made to feel welcome. My room was large and immaculate but with a very cosy old fashioned feel. The attention to detail at this place is astonishing. 
Jim the innkeeper ensures everything is just right for your stay and somehow manages to perfect being attentive whilst still giving you plenty of space.
The outdoor pool in the back garden is lovely. The property also has multiple relaxing communal areas including a front porch with rocking chairs and a cosy living/reading room which I unfortunately ran out of time to take advantage of.
I enjoyed that I could walk downtown and did not need to rely on my car during my stay (downtown is approximately 30 minute walk away). 
I could not recommend this place more highly. It is in a league of its own.

data.title: Beautiful B&B in Montgomery
data.text: Jim's inn is wonderful and he is such a lovely inn keeper!  My niece had stayed there when she traveled for her sorority when visiting a local chapter and recommended to my sister to give us a gift card to The Lattice Inn for Christmas. The cookies after our return from dinner were a perfect gesture!  Breakfast was delicious and we enjoyed visiting with the other couple from London!  Jim even had a bag of cookies for us to take as we left on our way home.  Highly recommend!

data.title: Amazing slice of Americana made all the more special by Jim.
data.text:
Wow, where to start with this place. The Lattice Inn was a fantastic experience from start to finish and a lot of of that was down to the innkeeper, Jim. From the moment we booked it, his correspondence was great. He asks for the names of both guests so he can do a welcome sign using scrabble tiles. He also emailed with recommendations for dining/entertainment a few days before we arrived. 
Once we arrived, the attention to detail was faultless. We were running late and Jim needed to go to the bank, so he'd written us a note and left our key. As it turned out, just as he was leaving, we arrived and so he turned his car around and came back to greet us.
The inn was fantastic; I don't think charming has ever been used more appropriately. It felt as if we'd been invited into someone's home, not a place of business and Jim continued this theme throughout our stay. From the banana bread on the bedside table when we got home from our evening meal - a place recommended by Jim - to the wonderful, freshly-cooked breakfast in the morning, Jim made sure no stone was left unturned to make our stay extra-special. He even rang the visitor's centre for us when I enquired as to the best place to get a Montgomery fridge magnet; my wife collects them on our travels and Jim made sure we got one. We stayed here at the start of our trip around the Deep South and by the time we got home, just over two weeks later, we were greeted with a postcard from Jim, thanking us for our stay. 
I can't recommend this place highly enough. If you're ever visiting Montgomery, be sure to make this your base; you won't regret it.

data.title: Jim is... Jim!
data.text:
Five stars for Jim, the inn keeper. Jim was ever so nice, telling us what to see and what to do - 
even before we arrived. The room was very nice as was the breakfast. Jim went out of his way to make us happy even offered to drive us to a restaurant although we had our own car.

data.title: Charming B&B in Montgomery
data.text:
I love supporting local businesses and had heard great things about The Lattice Inn. I had to spend one evening in Montgomery and Jim was so welcoming. He was waiting for me when I arrived and kindly pointed out what was available to eat within walking distance. Once I came back from dinner, it was so pleasant to find some slices of banana bread in my room.

The house is absolutely stunning, the bed comfortable, and room incredibly welcoming. Even though I was down in Montgomery to take an exam, the bed was comfortable enough to lull me to sleep. Breakfast was hearty and absolutely wonderful. As a cat lover, I really enjoyed seeing the resident cats milling about the dining room. I was so impressed with my stay at The Lattice Inn. I'll be staying in Montgomery again soon and will hopefully be able to book here again!

This place is a gem, and I've already recommended it to all my family and friends. If you find yourself in Montgomery, you'll really love it here.

data.title: Comments like these……
data.text: “Comments like these make the extra effort worthwhile”.  So wrote Jim (at the end of one review of the Inn), Inn Keeper, host and….certainly I’d say friend by the end of our stay of four days at The Lattice Inn.  There is nothing Jim would hold back on to give us much, much more than any stay in a hotel ever could….to personally give that “extra” to make the four days we spent in and around Montgomery so enjoyable.  We stayed in the Sandpiper Suite.  Impeccable in every way!  And a lovely bed to climb into….literally, and in which to fade into dreams at the end of the day “out”.  Everything about The Lattice Inn was just so right and so comfortable, restful on the mind.  Having visited a number of historic Inns in USA, we’ve come to understand that whilst a lovely old Inn furnished with beautiful furniture and decorative ornaments is a lovely experience to have enjoyed, the heart and soul of the Inn is the Inn Keeper.  Jim gave us heart, soul, friendship in every way.  We particularly enjoyed Jim sitting with us and fellow guests at breakfast each morning chatting as we ate his lovely breakfast meal, giving suggestions as to what we might do, where we might visit.  Cookies waiting for us when we got back was a thoughtful touch we just couldn’t contemplate happening in any hotel.  We were asked by some….”why visit Montgomery?”  Well, Jim and The Lattice Inn is one very good reason but we really did find lots to do and see in this quieter city.  I see The Lattice Inn is rated no.1 of 3 BnB’s in Montgomery, we’ve no knowledge of the other two, but can understand experiencing a stay in The Lattice Inn would be hard experience to beat for so many reasons.  Thank you, Jim, for our time in your lovely home.

data.title: Visit
data.text: My husband and I had a wonderful time at Lattice Inn. The accommodations were lovely and comfy. The breakfast was outstanding. We enjoyed relaxing by the pool. Jim is an excellent host and chef. You won't be disappointed!

data.title: An Idyllic Stay
data.text:
We couldn't have chosen a better place to stay in Montgomery, Alabama. Out in the leafy suburbs of Montgomery, this property exudes a wonderful southern charm. It's ideally placed in walking distance of some of the best restaurants in town as well as the charming Fitzgerald Museum. It's also only a 5 min uber from Central Montgomery. I'm so glad that we picked this place - we very nearly booked the comparatively soulless Hilton Double Tree in Central. Jim's place is full of personal touches that made us enjoy our time in Montgomery more than anywhere else we visited in the South!
Jim cooked a wonderful breakfast each morning and gave us fascinating anecdotes and insights into Southern/American life. He was happy to let me leaf through his book collection and even sent me links to all the music I enjoyed while in his house. He has a pool (not that we had time to go in!) as well as a beautiful lounge/library for use when you're not out and about. 

I can't recommend this B&B more!

data.title: Loved it
data.text:
We loved everything. The room, the hospitality and the great , tasty breakfast. Very nice owner. We will definitely stay there again. We can highly recommend this bed and breakfast.
Thank you for the great experience I had on my birthday.

data.title: Better bed than what I have at home
data.text: That bed was Goldie Lock's good. Three bears could have walked into that room and I would not have heard them. I slept so soundly. Love it. Loved your "break feast".. because it was the most delicious feast to ever start a day with. Jim is the welcoming, charming, thoughtful host. It was such a delight to meet him and stay with at the Lattice Inn.

data.title: Little Gem
data.text:
We loved our stay at the Lattice Inn and found Jim to be the most thoughtful host, every need was anticipated with extra little touches such as home made cookies and milk a welcome bonus.
We stayed in the Sandpiper Suite which was a delight, need to mention just how comfortable the bed/pillows are.
Our only disappointment is that we stayed just the one night, on our next visit it will definitely be longer.

data.title: Just what we were looking for
data.text:
Charming B&B built in early 1900s, classically and tastefully decorated with charming personal touches and Montgomery style. A pretty fireplace was next to our comfortable bed, the adjoining bathroom had an old school claw foot tub and refrigerator stocked with water and sodas. 

Breakfast was bountiful and delicious, veggie egg dishes with a side of southern grits and hearty tomato slices (and more!). We had good company each morning to share with as well.

Beautiful front porch as well as back porch and swimming area. Floral green gardens. The BnB is also next to a beautiful stone church. Loved the cat friend Charlie we saw from time to time.

Also had a wonderful time in MTG seeing baseball and local music, in addition to our family we visited.
